title: Case Management Walkthrough
description: Learn how to create, manage, and track legal cases from start to finish

steps.title: Navigate to Cases
steps.content: Click on 'Cases' in the sidebar to access the case management module. This is your central hub for managing all legal cases.

steps.title: Create New Case
steps.content: Click the '+ New Case' button to start creating a new case. This opens the case creation form with all necessary fields.

steps.title: Fill Case Details
steps.content: Complete the case information including title, client, case type, priority, and description. Required fields are marked with an asterisk.

steps.title: Assign Team Members
steps.content: Select the lead attorney and supporting team members. This determines who has access to the case and receives notifications.

steps.title: Set Important Dates
steps.content: Add key deadlines, court dates, and milestones. The system will automatically create reminders and track SLA compliance.

steps.title: Save the Case
steps.content: Click 'Save' to create the case. You'll be redirected to the case overview where you can add documents and tasks.

steps.title: Case List Overview
steps.content: View all your cases here. Use filters to find specific cases by status, client, or assigned team member. Click any case to view details.

steps.title: Case Actions
steps.content: Access quick actions like editing case details, adding documents, creating tasks, or changing case status from the action menu.

title: Document Management Tour
description: Master document upload, organization, and sharing workflows

steps.title: Access Documents
steps.content: Navigate to the Documents section to manage all your case-related files and folders.

steps.title: Folder Organization
steps.content: Documents are organized by case and folder type. You can create custom folders or use the default structure for pleadings, discovery, evidence, etc.

steps.title: Upload Documents
steps.content: Click 'Upload' to add new documents. You can drag and drop files or use the file browser to select multiple files at once.

steps.title: Document Details
steps.content: Add document descriptions, select the appropriate case and folder, and set access permissions. Use tags to make documents searchable.

steps.title: Document Preview
steps.content: Click on any document to preview it without downloading. The system supports PDF, images, and text documents for preview.

steps.title: Share Documents
steps.content: Use the share button to securely share documents with team members, clients, or external parties with appropriate access controls.

steps.title: Version Management
steps.content: When uploading a file with the same name, the system creates a new version. View version history and restore previous versions if needed.

steps.title: Search Documents
steps.content: Use the search function to find documents by name, content, tags, or metadata. Advanced filters help narrow down results.

title: Hearing Scheduling Guide
description: Learn to schedule court hearings and manage calendar integration

steps.title: Open Hearings Module
steps.content: Access the Hearings section to schedule court dates, depositions, and other case-related meetings.

steps.title: Calendar Overview
steps.content: View all scheduled hearings in calendar format. Switch between month, week, and day views to see different levels of detail.

steps.title: Schedule New Hearing
steps.content: Click 'Schedule Hearing' to create a new court appearance or meeting. This opens the hearing creation form.

steps.title: Hearing Information
steps.content: Fill in hearing details including case, type, court, judge, date, and time. Add a description and any special instructions.

steps.title: Manage Attendees
steps.content: Add attorneys, clients, witnesses, and other participants. The system will send calendar invitations to all attendees.

steps.title: Calendar Sync
steps.content: Enable calendar integration to automatically sync hearings with Google Calendar, Outlook, or other calendar systems.

steps.title: Set Reminders
steps.content: Configure automatic reminders for preparation tasks, document deadlines, and the hearing itself. Customize timing and recipients.

steps.title: Hearing Notes
steps.content: During or after the hearing, add notes, outcomes, and follow-up tasks. These become part of the case timeline.

title: Task Management System
description: Organize work with tasks, deadlines, and team collaboration

steps.title: Access Task Management
steps.content: Navigate to Tasks to view, create, and manage work items across all your cases and projects.

steps.title: Task Board View
steps.content: View tasks in different formats: list view for details, board view for workflow stages, or calendar view for deadlines.

steps.title: Create New Task
steps.content: Click 'New Task' to create work items. Tasks can be case-specific or general administrative work.

steps.title: Task Details
steps.content: Provide task description, priority level, due date, and estimated time. Link tasks to specific cases for better organization.

steps.title: Assign Tasks
steps.content: Assign tasks to team members, set dependencies, and configure approval workflows. Assigned users receive notifications.

steps.title: Track Progress
steps.content: Monitor task completion, time spent, and progress updates. Use status updates to keep stakeholders informed.

steps.title: Task Templates
steps.content: Use pre-defined task templates for common workflows like case intake, discovery, or trial preparation to ensure consistency.

steps.title: SLA Monitoring
steps.content: Track service level agreements and deadline compliance. The system alerts you when tasks approach their deadlines.

title: Client Portal Overview
description: Understanding the client-facing portal features and capabilities

steps.title: Client Portal Access
steps.content: The Client Portal provides secure access for clients to view their case information, documents, and communicate with the legal team.

steps.title: Client Dashboard
steps.content: Clients see a personalized dashboard with their active cases, recent updates, upcoming hearings, and important notifications.

steps.title: Document Sharing
steps.content: Control which documents clients can access. Set permissions for viewing, downloading, or uploading documents.

steps.title: Secure Messaging
steps.content: Clients can send secure messages to their legal team and receive important updates through the portal messaging system.

steps.title: Client Configuration
steps.content: Configure client access levels, notification preferences, and portal features available to different types of clients.

title: Reports and Analytics
description: Generate insights with comprehensive reporting tools

steps.title: Access Reporting
steps.content: Navigate to Reports to access comprehensive analytics and generate custom reports for cases, performance, and billing.

steps.title: Report Categories
steps.content: Choose from predefined report categories: Case Reports, Time & Billing, Performance Analytics, or create custom reports.

steps.title: Apply Filters
steps.content: Use date ranges, case types, team members, and other filters to focus your reports on specific data sets.

steps.title: Generate Reports
steps.content: Click 'Generate Report' to create your custom report. Reports can be viewed online, exported to PDF, or downloaded as Excel files.

steps.title: Schedule Reports
steps.content: Set up automatic report generation and delivery. Schedule weekly, monthly, or quarterly reports to be emailed to stakeholders.

steps.title: Dashboard Widgets
steps.content: Add key metrics to your dashboard for quick access to important statistics and performance indicators.

title: Task Automation Setup
description: Learn to create automation rules and templates for efficient task management

steps.title: Task Automation Overview
steps.content: Welcome to Task Automation! This powerful feature helps you automate repetitive tasks and ensure nothing falls through the cracks.

steps.title: Automation Rules Tab
steps.content: Click the Automation tab to access rule creation and management. This is where you'll set up triggers and actions.

steps.title: Create New Rule
steps.content: Click 'New Rule' to create your first automation rule. We'll walk you through the process step by step.

steps.title: Choose a Trigger
steps.content: Select when this automation should run. Common triggers include 'Hearing Updated', 'Document Uploaded', or 'Task Overdue'.

steps.title: Set Conditions
steps.content: Add conditions to filter when the rule runs. For example, 'Next Hearing Date in 3 days' or 'Case Status = Active'.

steps.title: Define Actions
steps.content: Specify what should happen when triggered. You can create tasks, send notifications, or update case status.

steps.title: Test Before Enabling
steps.content: Always test your rule with sample data before enabling it. This prevents issues with live cases.

steps.title: Task Templates
steps.content: Visit the Templates tab to create reusable task bundles for common workflows like 'Hearing Preparation' or 'Appeal Filing'.

title: Access & Roles Configuration
description: Set up role-based access control, data visibility, and team hierarchy for secure operations

steps.title: Security Control Center
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL MODULE: Access & Roles controls who can see and do what across your entire organization. Changes here affect all users immediately. Misconfiguration can expose client data or lock out staff.
steps.securityNote: All changes are logged in the Audit Log for compliance.

steps.title: User Assignments Tab
steps.content: Start here to manage role assignments. Search for employees, assign roles, and preview their effective permissions. This is where you control individual access.

steps.title: Assigning Roles
steps.content: Click [+] to assign a role. Users can have multiple roles - permissions combine additively (most permissive wins). Assignment takes effect on user's next page load.

steps.title: Preview Permissions
steps.content: Click the [Eye] icon to see a user's effective permissions across all assigned roles. Essential for troubleshooting 'I can't access...' issues.

steps.title: Role Definitions Tab
steps.content: View and edit role permission sets. System roles (Admin, Partner, Manager, Staff) are pre-configured. Create custom roles for specialized positions.

steps.title: Editing Permissions
steps.content: Click 'Edit Permissions' on any role card. Check/uncheck permissions per module. ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Changes affect ALL users with this role immediately.
steps.securityNote: Never grant 'rbac.admin' to non-admin roles - allows privilege escalation.

steps.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Data Scope
steps.content: Data Scope is the PRIMARY visibility control: 'Own Cases' = personal only, 'Team Cases' = you + your reports, 'All Cases' = organization-wide. Set in Employee Master. Incorrect scope exposes confidential data.
steps.securityNote: Default to 'Own Cases' for staff. Use 'All Cases' only for partners and compliance officers.

steps.title: Team Hierarchy Tab
steps.content: Visualize reporting relationships that drive 'Team Cases' visibility. Managers see all cases of their direct and indirect reports. Validate hierarchy before using Team Cases scope.

steps.title: Access Chain Inspector
steps.content: Click any employee in the hierarchy to see their complete access profile: Role, Scope, Reports, and accessible Cases/Clients/Tasks counts. Use to troubleshoot visibility issues.

steps.title: Portal Users Tab
steps.content: Manage external client access to the Client Portal. Portal users can view case documents and hearing schedules for their linked cases only.
steps.securityNote: ‚ö†Ô∏è Verify email belongs to actual client contact before sending invitation.

steps.title: Audit Log Tab
steps.content: View immutable record of all permission changes. Required for compliance (SOC2, ISO 27001). Use for security investigations and quarterly access reviews.

steps.title: Security Best Practices
steps.content: ‚úÖ Maintain 2+ admin accounts always ‚úÖ Document all admin grants ‚úÖ Review access quarterly ‚úÖ Use 'Own Cases' as default ‚úÖ Test role changes before deployment

steps.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common Pitfalls to Avoid
steps.content: ‚ùå Removing last admin (lockout risk) ‚ùå Granting 'All Cases' without justification ‚ùå Staff with delete permissions ‚ùå Portal invites to wrong email ‚ùå Not updating roles when positions change

title: Legal Hierarchy Configuration
description: Configure courts, tribunals, and authority levels for your practice

steps.title: Understanding Legal Hierarchy
steps.content: The legal hierarchy defines how cases move through the appellate system. Configure this correctly for proper case routing and deadline management.

steps.title: Authority Levels
steps.content: Start by defining authority levels: Supreme Court ‚Üí High Court ‚Üí Tribunal ‚Üí Appellate Authority ‚Üí Adjudicating Authority. This is the appeal chain.

steps.title: Adding Authorities
steps.content: Click 'Add Authority' to create entries for courts and tribunals you appear before. Include full names, codes, and jurisdiction details.

steps.title: Jurisdiction Configuration
steps.content: Map each authority to its geographic jurisdiction. This helps auto-select the correct forum based on client location.

steps.title: Matter Types
steps.content: Define which case types (GST, Customs, Income Tax) each authority handles. This filters options during case creation.

steps.title: Hierarchy Visualization
steps.content: Click 'View Hierarchy' to see the complete appellate structure as a tree diagram. Verify connections are correct.

title: Employee Management Setup
description: Configure your team with proper roles, access, and hierarchy

steps.title: Employee Management
steps.content: This is where you configure your team. Every employee needs a profile with role, data scope, and module access defined.

steps.title: Adding Employees
steps.content: Click 'Add Employee' to create a new team member. Enter name, email, and select their operational role.

steps.title: Role Assignment
steps.content: Select the operational role: Partner/CA, Manager, Advocate, or Staff. This determines recommended data scope and default permissions.

steps.title: Data Scope Configuration
steps.content: Set data scope based on role: Partners see 'All Cases', Managers see 'Team Cases', Staff see 'Own Cases'. Adjust as needed.

steps.title: Reporting Structure
steps.content: Set 'Reports To' to create the team hierarchy. This affects 'Team Cases' visibility - managers see their reports' cases.

steps.title: Module Access
steps.content: Select which modules this employee can access. Unselected modules are hidden from their sidebar.

steps.title: View Organization Chart
steps.content: Click 'View Org Chart' to see the complete team hierarchy. Verify reporting relationships are correct.

title: Statutory Deadlines Configuration
description: Set up event types and deadline calculation rules

steps.title: Statutory Deadlines
steps.content: Statutory deadlines are critical in litigation. Configure event types here, and the system automatically calculates due dates for your cases.

steps.title: Event Types
steps.content: Event types define triggering events (Notice Received, Order Passed) with their statutory time limits. Pre-configured for common GST events.

steps.title: Adding Event Types
steps.content: Click 'Add Event Type' to create new deadline rules. Specify the event name and statutory days allowed (e.g., 30 days for reply).

steps.title: Authority-Specific Rules
steps.content: Some events have different deadlines per authority. Configure overrides for specific courts or tribunals here.

steps.title: Holiday Calendar
steps.content: Import court holidays to adjust deadline calculations. Deadlines falling on holidays are automatically extended to next working day.

steps.title: Alert Configuration
steps.content: Configure when deadline reminders are sent: 7 days, 3 days, 1 day before. Set recipients and notification channels.

steps.title: Test Deadline Calculation
steps.content: Use 'Calculate Deadline' with sample data to verify your configuration. Check that holidays are correctly excluded.

title: Compliance Dashboard Overview
description: Monitor deadline compliance and identify risks across your practice

steps.title: Compliance Dashboard
steps.content: Your early warning system for compliance risks. See deadline status, SLA adherence, and risk indicators at a glance.

steps.title: Key Metrics
steps.content: The overview shows: Overdue items (red), Due this week (amber), On track (green). Click any metric to see details.

steps.title: Deadline Details
steps.content: The Deadlines tab shows all upcoming and overdue statutory deadlines. Filter by case, authority, or date range.

steps.title: Risk Indicators
steps.content: Cases are color-coded by risk: Red = overdue or imminent deadline, Amber = deadline within 7 days, Green = on track.

steps.title: Team Performance
steps.content: See compliance metrics by team member. Identify who needs support or has capacity for more work.

steps.title: Export Reports
steps.content: Click 'Export Report' to download compliance status as PDF or Excel for management review or audit documentation.

title: System Settings Configuration
description: Complete walkthrough of system configuration with security and governance focus

steps.title: System Settings Overview
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è ADMIN-ONLY MODULE: System Settings is the central configuration hub affecting ALL users and workflows. Changes propagate immediately. All modifications are logged for audit compliance.

steps.title: Settings Navigation
steps.content: Use the sidebar to navigate between settings sections. Sections are organized by function: General, Security, Notifications, Legal, AI, Integrations, Address, Templates, Hierarchy, and Data Management.

steps.title: General Settings
steps.content: Configure performance parameters: file size limits, cache duration, query timeouts. These affect ALL users. Start with defaults and adjust based on actual usage patterns.

steps.title: Security Settings - CRITICAL
steps.content: üîí SECURITY CRITICAL: Configure session timeout (30 min recommended), password policy (Medium+), and 2FA (admin only minimum). Incorrect settings can expose client data or lock out users.

steps.title: IP Whitelist Warning
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è DANGER: IP whitelist can lock out ALL users including yourself. Always include your current IP. Have backend access ready before enabling. Test with VPN to verify.

steps.title: Notification Settings
steps.content: Configure email provider with app-specific password (not main password). Test email delivery before enabling for all users. Set reminder schedule for hearings (1,3,7 days recommended).

steps.title: Test Email Configuration
steps.content: Always use 'Test Email' button to verify configuration works. Check inbox AND spam folder. Fix errors before enabling notifications. Failed emails mean missed deadlines.

steps.title: Legal Configuration
steps.content: Set case number format BEFORE creating cases - changes affect only new cases. Configure financial year per your jurisdiction (April for India). Set realistic SLA times.

steps.title: Integration Settings
steps.content: Connect calendars via OAuth for hearing sync. For GST portal: ALWAYS test in Sandbox mode first before switching to Production. Production mode queries real GST portal.

steps.title: Legal Hierarchy
steps.content: Define authority levels (Assessment ‚Üí Supreme Court) and matter types. This affects case categorization and appeal workflows. Deactivating a level hides it from forms but preserves existing data.

steps.title: Data Management - DANGER ZONE
steps.content: ‚õî CRITICAL SECTION: Contains irreversible actions including 'Clear All Data'. Enable Production Mode before go-live. ALWAYS export backup before any data operations.

steps.title: Production Mode
steps.content: Enable Production Mode to: disable sample data generation, add confirmation dialogs for destructive actions, enable full audit logging. This should be ON for all live deployments.

steps.title: Production Readiness Check
steps.content: Run this check before go-live. Validates: RLS policies, authentication, backups, security settings, email configuration. Address ALL issues before deploying to production users.

steps.title: Save Your Changes
steps.content: Click 'Save Settings' to apply all changes. Most settings take effect immediately. Critical settings (IP whitelist, production mode) may show confirmation dialogs. Changes are logged for audit.

title: Legal Authorities Configuration
description: Learn to configure courts, tribunals, and adjudicating bodies that form the foundation of case jurisdiction

steps.title: Legal Authorities Overview
steps.content: Legal Authorities define WHERE cases are heard. Every case, hearing, and judge is linked to a Legal Authority. Accurate authority data ensures correct statutory deadlines and proper jurisdiction.

steps.title: Authority Level Hierarchy
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Authority Level determines appellate hierarchy and statutory deadline rules. Levels: AO (Assessment) ‚Üí ADJ (Adjudication) ‚Üí AA (Appellate) ‚Üí TRIB (Tribunal) ‚Üí HC ‚Üí SC. Wrong level = wrong deadlines.

steps.title: Add New Authority
steps.content: Click 'Add Authority' to create a new court or tribunal. Search existing authorities first to avoid duplicates. Duplicates cause fragmented case history.

steps.title: Configure Matter Types
steps.content: Specify which case types this authority handles (GST, Income Tax, etc.). This filters the matter type dropdown when creating cases at this authority. Leave empty to allow all types.

steps.title: Set Jurisdiction
steps.content: Define geographic or subject-matter coverage. Used for case routing and jurisdiction-based reports. Example: 'Maharashtra', 'Central Excise', 'All India'.

steps.title: GSTAT Bench Configuration
steps.content: For GST Tribunals, select the state first to auto-populate bench locations from the GSTAT_STATE_BENCHES mapping. Each state has predefined bench locations.

steps.title: Linking Judges
steps.content: After creating an authority, you can add judges assigned to it. Judges MUST be linked to an authority to appear in hearing forms. Create authority first, then judges.

steps.title: Deadline Rule Impact
steps.content: Authority level triggers statutory deadline rules. When cases are created at this authority, the system applies deadline rules matching this level. Test with sample case after setup.

steps.title: Bulk Import
steps.content: Use Import to add multiple authorities at once from official court directories. Always run 'Check for duplicates' before import to prevent fragmented data.

steps.title: Deactivate, Don't Delete
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è Never delete authorities with linked cases. Instead, mark as 'Inactive' to hide from dropdowns while preserving case history. System prevents deletion of linked authorities.

title: Judges Master Configuration
description: Configure judicial officers and bench assignments for accurate hearing scheduling

steps.title: Judges Master Overview
steps.content: Judges preside over hearings and deliver orders. Each judge must be assigned to a Legal Authority. Accurate judge data ensures correct bench assignments and case-judge matching.

steps.title: Prerequisite: Legal Authorities
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Legal Authorities must exist BEFORE adding judges. A judge cannot be created without a court assignment. Create the court/tribunal first if it doesn't exist.

steps.title: Add New Judge
steps.content: Click 'Add Judge' to create a new judicial officer. Include full name with honorific (Hon'ble Justice/Member). Search first to avoid duplicates.

steps.title: Court Assignment (Required)
steps.content: Select the Legal Authority where this judge is assigned. The judge will ONLY appear in hearing dropdowns for this specific court. This is a required field.

steps.title: Set Specializations
steps.content: Add areas of expertise (Tax Law, Constitutional, Commercial). Base on case types actually heard, not general qualifications. Used for case-judge matching recommendations.

steps.title: Status Management
steps.content: Keep status current: Active, On Leave, Transferred, Retired, Elevated. Non-Active judges are hidden from hearing dropdowns. Update immediately on any status change.

steps.title: Handling Transfers
steps.content: When a judge transfers: Update the court_id to new court (don't create new record). Add note documenting transfer. Past hearing records remain correctly linked.

steps.title: Judge in Hearings
steps.content: Once created, judges appear in hearing forms when the matching court is selected. Multiple judges can be assigned to represent a full bench composition.

steps.title: Privacy Best Practice
steps.content: Store only official contact details (chamber, registry). Never store personal phone or email addresses. Notes should contain only professional observations.

title: Contact Directory Management
description: Manage people relationships including client representatives, opposing counsel, and stakeholders

steps.title: Contact Directory Overview
steps.content: Contacts represent people involved in cases - client representatives, opposing counsel, government officers. They enable communication, portal access, and case party identification.

steps.title: Standalone vs Client-Linked
steps.content: Two types: Standalone (prospects, opposing counsel) and Client-Linked (client employees). Link to client only when relationship is confirmed. Client-linked contacts can get portal access.

steps.title: Add New Contact
steps.content: Click 'Add Contact' to create. Search by email/phone first to avoid duplicates. Duplicates split communication history and cause confusion.

steps.title: Link to Client
steps.content: To associate with a client, select the client organization. This enables portal access and inherits client visibility. VERIFY correct client - affects portal access.

steps.title: Data Scope (Visibility)
steps.content: For standalone contacts: OWN (only you see), TEAM (your team sees), ALL (everyone sees). Use OWN for prospects, ALL for shared resources like court registries.

steps.title: Assign Roles
steps.content: Roles define contact's function: Signatory (signs documents), Coordinator (main contact), Billing (handles invoices), Decision Maker. Assign all applicable roles.

steps.title: Portal Access (Critical)
steps.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è SECURITY CRITICAL: Portal access lets contact view case data. ALWAYS verify identity before enabling. Only for client-linked contacts. Wrong access = data breach.

steps.title: Primary Contact
steps.content: Mark one contact per client as Primary. Primary receives important notifications and appears first in lists. Verify identity before marking - they'll receive sensitive info.

steps.title: Deduplication
steps.content: Run monthly duplicate check using email/phone matching. Merge duplicates to consolidate history. Use Admin merge tool when duplicates found.

title: Case Operations Workflow
description: Learn day-to-day case management operations: navigation, filtering, SLA monitoring, and quick actions

steps.title: Daily Dashboard
steps.content: Start your day here. Dashboard shows SLA alerts, today's tasks, upcoming hearings, and recent activity. Check red indicators first - they need immediate attention.

steps.title: Case List Filters
steps.content: Use quick filters: 'My Cases' for assigned work, 'Team Cases' for oversight, 'SLA Breach' for urgency. Combine filters for precise views.

steps.title: SLA Status Colors
steps.content: üü¢ Green = On track. üü° Yellow = Approaching deadline. üî¥ Red = Breached or imminent. Click any indicator for deadline details.

steps.title: Case Tab Navigation
steps.content: Each case has tabs: Overview, Lifecycle, Timeline, Documents, Hearings, AI Assistant, Communications. Use tabs for focused work.

steps.title: Timeline Review
steps.content: Timeline shows all case events chronologically. Use filters for specific event types. Essential for hearing preparation and audit trails.

steps.title: Quick Actions Menu
steps.content: Access common actions: Schedule Hearing, Create Task, Send Update. Use keyboard shortcuts (hover buttons to see) for speed.

steps.title: AI Assistant Tab
steps.content: Ask AI for case summaries, draft assistance, or research. AI has context of current case. Be specific in your prompts for best results.

steps.title: Bulk Operations
steps.content: Select multiple cases for bulk actions: status update, assignment change, export. Always verify selection count before executing.

title: Daily Workflow Guide
description: Efficient daily routine: morning review, task management, hearing prep, and end-of-day wrap-up

steps.title: Morning: Dashboard Check
steps.content: Start here every morning. Check: 1) Red SLA alerts, 2) Today's tasks, 3) Today's hearings, 4) Overnight notifications. Takes 5 minutes.

steps.title: Morning: Task Triage
steps.content: Open Task Board. Filter to 'My Tasks'. Review overdue (red), update in-progress statuses, prioritize today's due items.

steps.title: Check Hearings Calendar
steps.content: Review today and tomorrow's hearings. Verify preparation status. Check for any scheduling conflicts or last-minute changes.

steps.title: Throughout Day: Status Updates
steps.content: As you work, update task status immediately. Move to 'In Progress' when starting, 'Done' when finishing. This keeps dashboards accurate.

steps.title: Log Communications
steps.content: After client calls or meetings, log them immediately. Click '+ Log Communication' to record. Fresh details are more accurate.

steps.title: End of Day: Wrap Up
steps.content: Before leaving: 1) Update all task statuses, 2) Record any hearing outcomes, 3) Send pending client updates, 4) Check tomorrow's schedule.

title: Hearing Lifecycle Management
description: Complete hearing workflow: scheduling, preparation, attendance, and outcome recording

steps.title: Schedule New Hearing
steps.content: Click 'Schedule Hearing'. Select case, date/time, court, and judge. Check calendar for conflicts before confirming.

steps.title: Conflict Detection
steps.content: System warns if you have overlapping hearings. Red indicator shows conflict. Reschedule one of the conflicting hearings.

steps.title: Set Reminders
steps.content: Configure reminders: 1 week for preparation, 1 day for final check. Reminders go to assigned advocate and any attendees.

steps.title: Preparation Checklist
steps.content: Use Preparation tab before hearing. Check documents gathered, arguments prepared, case timeline reviewed. Mark 'Prepared' when ready.

steps.title: Record Outcome
steps.content: After hearing, click 'Record Outcome'. Select result type: Adjourned, Order Passed, etc. This triggers appropriate follow-up tasks.

steps.title: Link Next Hearing
steps.content: If adjourned, schedule next hearing from outcome form. This links hearings together and maintains continuity in case history.

steps.title: Upload Order
steps.content: When order is passed, upload the order document immediately. Link it to this hearing for proper case history and timeline.
